p:
Thus, a plot of ic as a function of v yields a straight line with a slope equal to C dl. By plotting the Δj against the scan rate at 0.1 V (vs. Ag/AgCl), the slope which is twice of C dl can be obtained as shown in Fig. 6f. The C dl of linear fitting slope are 27.55, 43.55, 51, 51.75, and 43.73 mF cm −2 for NPMCNT-50, NPMCNT-100, NPMCNT-200, NPMCNT-300, and NPMCNT-400, respectively. The ECSA of a electrocatalyst sample is calculated from the C dl according to Eq. ( 2):
14

ECSA =
C dl
/
C s
